title: Plan: Replace PdfDSL with Document DSL
description:
## Context
The existing PdfDSL system (~2,600 lines) was never used in production. We've built a powerful verb system via Components::All that pages use for declarative content rendering.

## Goals
1. Delete PdfDSL - remove unused code
2. Build DocumentBuilder - clean orchestration DSL
3. Refactor PlannerGenerator - use DocumentBuilder internally

## Key Design Principle
Clear separation between:
- **Orchestration** (DocumentBuilder) - declares WHICH pages
- **Content** (Pages::All verbs) - defines WHAT's drawn on pages

## Target API
```ruby
BujoPdf.define_pdf(title: "Planner 2025", year: 2025, output: "planner.pdf") do
  index_pages(2)
  future_log_pages(2)
  page :seasonal
  weeks_in(year).each do |week|
    quarterly_planning_for(week) if week.starts_quarter?
    page :weekly, week: week
  end
  grid_pages
  template_pages
end
```

comments.author: andy

title: PageSet abstraction for multi-page spreads (Index, FutureLog, Weekly)
description:
## Architecture Vision

PageSet as a **child context** of PageContext (evolved RenderContext), not a separate orchestration layer.

### Layered Context Model
```
PageContext (unified page context)
├── Global PDF state: year, total_weeks, date_config, event_store
├── Current page state: page_number, page_key
├── .set (PageSet::Context) - when inside a page_set block
│   ├── page (1-based position in set)
│   ├── total (count of pages in set)
│   ├── label (interpolated string like "Index 1 of 2")
│   ├── first?, last?
│   └── name (set name)
└── Page-specific extras via **data
```

### Target API
```ruby
# DSL in builder/mixin
page_set(2, "Index %page of %total") do |set|
  set.each { |i| index_page(num: i + 1) }
end

# In pages
context.set?           # => true
context.set.page       # => 1
context.set.label      # => "Index 1 of 2"
draw_set_label         # renders footer automatically
```

### Key Design Decisions
1. PageSet is child of PageContext (`context.set`), not parallel
2. Null object pattern - `context.set` always exists
3. DSL block scoping auto-populates context.set
4. build_context picks up current page set state automatically

See plan: ~/.claude/plans/jiggly-churning-moth.md

title: Add page_set DSL to MixinSupport
description:
## Context
The page_set DSL allows builders to declare page sets. It auto-populates context.set for pages generated inside the block.

## Implementation
In `lib/bujo_pdf/pages/mixin_support.rb`:

### Add page_set method
```ruby
def page_set(count, label = nil, name: nil)
  set = PageSet.new(count: count, label: label, name: name)
  if block_given?
    set.each do |i|  # 0-based
      @current_page_set = set
      @current_page_set_index = i
      yield set
    end
  else
    set  # return for manual use
  end
ensure
  @current_page_set = nil
  @current_page_set_index = nil
end
```

### Update build_context
After creating PageContext, attach set context if inside page_set block:
```ruby
if @current_page_set
  ctx.set = @current_page_set[@current_page_set_index]
end
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] page_set(n, label) { } iterates n times
- [ ] Pages inside block have context.set populated
- [ ] Pages outside block have context.set as NullContext
- [ ] Block scoping works correctly (nested sets?)

comments.author: andy
comments.text: Commit c0574cc: Added page_set DSL method and updated build_context to auto-populate context.set inside block. All acceptance criteria verified with tests.

title: Add draw_set_label helper to Pages::Base
description:
## Context
Standard footer rendering for pages in a set.

## Implementation
In `lib/bujo_pdf/pages/base.rb`:

```ruby
def draw_set_label(col: 2, row: 54, width: 39)
  return unless context.set?
  
  text(col, row, context.set.label,
       size: 9, color: '999999', width: width,
       align: :center, position: :subscript)
end
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] No-op when not in a page set
- [ ] Renders context.set.label when in a set
- [ ] Customizable position via col/row/width params

title: Add layout helper meta-components for margins, columns, rows
description:
Create meta-components that help with common layout calculations:

- **Margins**: Inset content by N boxes on each side
- **Columns**: Split a region into N equal columns (box-quantized)
- **Rows**: Split a region into N equal rows (box-quantized)

These would be calculation helpers rather than rendering components,
returning bounds that other components can use.

Example usage ideas:
```ruby
# Get inset bounds
inner = margins(col, row, width, height, left: 2, right: 2)

# Split into quantized columns
cols = columns(col, row, width, height, count: 3, gap: 1)
cols.each { |c| ruled_lines(c.col, c.row, c.width, c.height) }

# Split into quantized rows
rows = rows(col, row, width, height, count: 4, gap: 1)
```

Discovered while building RuledLines component - the old SubComponent::RuledLines
had margin support that was removed for simplicity. These meta-components would
provide a cleaner, composable approach.

title: Create DocumentBuilder orchestration class
description:
Create lib/bujo_pdf/document_builder.rb - the core orchestration DSL.

## Core Method: page(type, **options)
- Calls start_new_page
- Builds RenderContext
- Calls PageFactory.create and generate
- Tracks page numbers for outline

## Convenience Methods
- index_pages(count)
- future_log_pages(count)
- grid_pages
- template_pages
- collection_pages
- weeks_in(year) -> returns Week objects
- quarterly_planning_for(week)
- monthly_review_for(week)

## Entry Point
```ruby
def generate(&block)
  Prawn::Document.generate(@output, page_size: 'LETTER', margin: 0) do |pdf|
    @pdf = pdf
    DotGrid.create_stamp(pdf, 'page_dots')
    instance_eval(&block)
    build_outline
  end
end
```

title: Refactor PlannerGenerator to use DocumentBuilder
description:
Refactor PlannerGenerator to use DocumentBuilder internally.

## Before
~500 lines of procedural page generation with manual RenderContext creation

## After
Thin wrapper that declares pages using DocumentBuilder DSL:

```ruby
def generate(filename)
  DocumentBuilder.new(year: @year, output: filename).generate do
    index_pages(INDEX_PAGE_COUNT)
    future_log_pages(FUTURE_LOG_PAGE_COUNT)
    page :seasonal
    page :year_events
    page :year_highlights
    page :multi_year

    weeks_in(@year).each do |week|
      quarterly_planning_for(week) if week.starts_quarter?
      monthly_review_for(week) if week.starts_month?
      page :weekly, week: week
    end

    grid_pages
    template_pages
    collection_pages
  end
end
```
